p: The promoter of large yellow croaker elovl6, an upstream sequence of 2021 bp adjacent to the start of elovl6 was cloned to characterize the transcriptional regulatory mechanism of elovl6. Using bioinformatics software including JASPAR, TRANSFAC, and TF binding, several transcriptional factors binding sites including hepatocyte nuclear factor 1α (HNF1α), CCAAT-enhancer-binding protein β (CEBPβ), peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor γ (PPARγ), transcriptional factor SP1 (SP1), retinoid X receptor α (RXRα), ChREB, SREBP1, SREBP2, LXRα, and cAMP response element-binding protein (CREB1) were predicted within the elovl6 promoter region of large yellow croaker. The results of dual-luciferase reporter assays showed that the transcription factor HNF1α, CEBPβ, RXRα, ChREB, SREBP2, and CREB1 upregulated the promoter activity of elovl6 by 1.78-fold, 2.35-fold, 2.32-fold, 1.80-fold, 1.51-fold, and 2.68-fold, respectively. Interestingly, PPARγ, SP1, SREBP1, and LXRα, as important transcription factors in regulation of elovl6 in mammals, showed no significantly regulatory effect on elovl6 promoter in large yellow croaker ( Figure 7).
